definitions.definition: showing that you really mean the opposite of what you are saying; expressing irony

examples.text: He was greeted with ironic cheers from opposition MPs.
She sent him a faintly ironic sideways glance.

definitions.definition: strange or funny because it is very different from what you expect

examples.text: It's ironic that she became a teacher—she used to hate school.

wordOrigin: mid 17th cent.: from French ironique or late Latin ironicus, from Greek eirōnikos ‘dissembling, feigning ignorance’, from eirōneia ‘simulated ignorance’, from eirōn ‘dissembler’.
